intro: Gymnosphaera boivinii var. lobata, commonly known as the lobed gymnosphaera, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Santalaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves that give it its common name. The plant is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it partially relies on other plants for water and nutrients. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
